intro: Alectorolophus major var. bosnensis, commonly known as the Bosnian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in woodland or meadow habitats. It has lanceolate leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
